Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When coughs and diseases of the lung are from cold humors and the patient has no fever nor tisis, and it is an old disease, then cauterize that with two cauteries on the furcula in the pre-affected areas of the loins and hips; and with another cautery in the middle area of the chest between two nipples; and let the cautery be clavilated according to the previous form.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you wish, let your cauterization be pointed with the cautery that is called a point, in the form which precedes in the pointing of pain of the ears.
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And make points until they reach those; and then heal that wound which has been previously mentioned until it is healthy.
E ya sia le cauteri haventz tres ramps quar cauterizacio es am aquel: am una veguada podes far tres cauteris segon aquesta forma:	And thus the cautery has three ramps because cauterization is thus: in one way you can do three cauteries according to this form.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	On the cauterization of twitching that is at the head of the helper.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the head of the helper is dislocated due to lubricating humors and does not stop at the hour of its return, until it returns to its usual custom, and then by a small movement it is displaced thus that it ends, thus as we have testified, then cover that primarily you reduce the dislocation, and then the patient is reversed over the two or on the side; and then elevate the skin which is in the upper part of the citillic to the parts above with your left hand, if the joint is dislocated above.
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then ignite the cautery having two heads; and this is its form.
E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	And then cauterize the skin until it penetrates to the other side; and you will find the figure of cauterization with four heads of cauteries.
e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And thus those subtleties according to the quantity of tension; and this is its form.
E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	And some occasions are adjusted according to this count and because they are the eight cauteries.
E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat.	And then pause over the cautery, which is good for salt, and then make the patient adhere to tranquility, and the member should not be moved for some time until it is comforted.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas desus e tart es fayt aquo, lahoras cauteriza sobre le muscle am cauteri clavilh o am motz cauteris puntan, quar la junctura es confermada e la humiditat es romauguda e le malaute es sanat.	And if the dislocation is above and it is thus done, then cauterize over the muscle with a clavilated cautery or with many pointed cauteries, because the joint is confirmed and the humidity is removed and the patient is healthy.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De cauterizacio del stomac.	On the cauterization of the stomach.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When cold and many humors come into the stomach, extracting its complexity and thus multiplying the raumases within it, and if you continue the manners of cure and do not confuse, then cover that the patient is on their back with their arms extended and their thighs, and then cauterize that with three cauteries: one cautery below the chest for the quantity of a finger in a clavilated cautery, and two cauteries below the sides of the chest; until the figure of the triangular cautery appears; and elongate among those who are not adjusted, so they will not make an error.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And if the depth of the cautery reaches the quantity of the two stubborn roots of the greatness of the codena.
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	And the shape of the cautery is added in this way, And if you want, make a great cautery in the middle of the stomach in this way; and let it be a cautery in the form of a circle in this way.
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	And the stomach should be cautered at the point where it is frightened by this cautery: and it is that you feel on the stomach point according to the quantity that you want to hold, and then cautered in those points; and then cure with the cure that precedes until it is healed.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	On the cautery of the fevered foot.
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	When the foot hurts from coldness or dampness or gross excess of wind that disrupts its normal complete function, and it is cured with water as we have said, and not comforted, then it is necessary that the malady be resupinated above its cervix, and you feel with a tender hand three cauteries according to this form and quantity measured on the foot below the hips, which perceives the decubitus of the same.
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	And let the space be that which is between each cautery according to the greatness of the finger, and let the cautery be according to the length of the right body.
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	And do not comprehend your hand with the moving cautery.
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses.	And if the quantity of water that is absorbed is equal to the quantity of the magnitude of the specificity of the codena, and it is not yet adjusted; and if the malady stands on its feet; and if it does not stand, then let it be seated, which has already extended its thighs, and elevated its shoulders.
E es aquesta la forma del cauteri:	And this is the form of the cautery:
E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	And it is possible that you can cauterie these cauteries with a cutting cautery, when you are subtle and prudent in the art.
E guarda te que trop no procesiscas en la cauterizacio, e sia adhurida la specitut de tota la codena per que sia adhurit tot le cors e pervengua entro als budels, quar la codena aqui es subtil; e sapias aquo.	And beware that you do not proceed excessively in the cautery, and let the specificity of the entire codena be absorbed so that it is absorbed throughout the body and penetrates into the intestines, because the codena here is subtle; and know this.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	On the perforation of an abscess on the foot with a cautery.
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When an ulcer or abscess occurs on the foot and you want to know if that abscess is in the flesh of the foot or in its tunic, then if it is in the flesh of the foot, the malady becomes more grave and the pain is increased.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if it is in the tunic of the foot, then the pain is greatly increased and sometimes the doctors are tired of curing it.
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina.	Therefore it is necessary that the malady be turned above its cervix; and then feel the place of the abscess with a tender hand; and then ignite the cautery which is assembled like a rag, in the form of which I have written on the other page.
E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	And cauterie with that cautery until the entire codena is consumed, until it reaches the siphac, until it arrives at a healthy sanity.
E aprop cura aquel per curacio dels autres apostemas entro que sia sanat.	And then cure it by curing other abscesses until it is healed.
E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	And it is not suitable that this form of cautery be used unless the one who has studied in the art of medicine is prolonged, and in the hands of which many maladies are recognized; however, I have experimented with some vigorous practices being carried out above this operation, however, I will leave that to you, and it is better.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De cauterizacio de plauresi.	On the cautery of flatulence.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	The ancient cauteries of the roots of Aristology for flatulence are made according to this manner, being a doer, and it is that which you take from the roots of Aristology, a long dry root that is found, and let it be of the greatness of the finger.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	And then submerge it in oil and heat it at the fire, and then cauterie with a cautery in that place which is between the continuation of the furcula and the neck; and make two small cauteries below guiding, one declining to the part that is beneath the beard, and make two cauteries on that which declines between the fifth rib and the cistern, declining slightly towards the back parts; and make another cautery in the middle of the foot, and another above the stomach, and three cauteries from the back parts; and make one cautery in that place which is between the two shoulders, and make two cauteries of the two sides of the foot, below the cautery which is between the two shoulders.
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	And it is not suitable that you comprehend your hand with the cautery, but rather it should be in the manifestation of the codena in action.
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge.	And I have already said to the other ancients that they are similar to those of men who use iron cauteries resembling a ray and ignite them, and place them in that place which is between the ribs, until they reach that abscess and healthy sanity is forgotten, just as we have said about the abscess on the foot.
Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	More in this perforation I do not use cautery, because it often happens that an abscess forms at the site of the fistula, which does not heal.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter xxx.
De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	On the cautery of the spleen.
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	When you treat the disease of the spleen as we have said in the division and do not confuse your treatment, then cautery is done in three ways, all of which are direct, one of which is to make three or four linear incisions according to the length of the spleen, following the shape of the cauteries of the foot, whose shape has preceded.
E sia entre quascun cauteri la grossetut d’un dit o un pauc mes, e la manieyra del cauteri sia la manieyra la qual havem dita en le cauteri del fietge engualment.	And it is between each cautery the width of a finger or a little more, and the method of the cautery is the same as we have said in the cautery of the foot, equally.
E no compremas la tua ma am le cauteri; e le malaute sia eves sobre lo sieu dos.	And do not comprehend your hand at the cautery; and the disease is evident on both sides of the back.
E es autra manieyra de cauterizar, so es que tu igniscas le cauteri haventz dos vertimentz, la qual causa havem dita en le capitol de dislocacio del muscle, e elava la codena la qual es en le endreyt de la melsa la hon perve le jazer del malaute sinistre.	And there is another way of cauterying, so it is that you ignite the cautery having two vertebrae, which causes have been said in the chapter on dislocation of the muscle, and it raises the codeine which is at the end of the spleen where it perceives the sinister influence of the disease.
E sia la tua elevacio am la qual elevas la codena segon la longuesa del cors, per que sian faytz cauteris segon la latitut del cos.	And it is your elevation where you raise the codeine according to the length of the body, so that you make several cauteries according to the width of the body.
E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	And then introduce the two vertebrae, setting them in motion, in that entrance where they penetrate the codeine of the other part.
E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	And then extract the cautery; and thus you make four cauteries.
E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	And if you wish, cautery with a cautery having three vertebrae.
E aprop tu cura le cauteri pus que aia laysat de getar brac per trops jorns, quar mays es comferent que las autras causas precedentz en la curacio.	And then you cure the cautery, so that it has laid aside to grasp or to hold for three days, because more often it is comfortable than the other preceding causes in the cure.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter XXI.
De cauterizacio de ydropici.	On the cautery of hydropsy.
Cauteri no catz en ydropici sino en alcinte3 propriament.	Cauteries are not made in hydropsy except at a precise point.
Quan tu curas le ydropic am las manieyras de curacio las quals havem ditas en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que aquel cauterizes am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic e am un cauteri sobre l’estomac, e am autre cauteri sobre le fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa, e am dos cauteris entre les spondils del dos, e un cauteri en lo dreyt del pietz, e am autre cauteri sobre l’estomac.	When you treat hydropsy, the methods of treatment are those which have been said in the division and do not confuse your treatment, then it is necessary that those cauteries are four cauteries in the circuit of the navel and one on the stomach, and another on the foot, and another on the spleen, and two between the vertebrae of the back, and one on the right side of the foot, and another on the stomach.
E la quantitat de la profunditat del cauteri sia propdana a la spicitut de la codena.	And the quantity of the depth of the cautery is proportionate to the specificity of the codeine.
E aprop layssa le cauteri ubert per so que gete brac per lonc temps.	And then leave the cautery open so that it holds for a long time.
E no evacuas le malaute de curacio aprop le cauteri am aquo que cove per que sian agreguadas a lu doas entencios, e sira festinada a lu am ajutori sanacio.	And do not evacuate the disease from treatment then with the cautery as it is necessary that they be added to the two intentions, and it will be fastened to the aid of health.
La forma del cauteri am lo qual es cauterizat lo ventre sia clavilh segon que la forma de aquel es desus precedent, e es aquel am le qual es cauterizat le dos sia olivar segon qu’es precedent a la sua forma.	The shape of the cautery is what is cauterying the belly is club-shaped according to the shape of that which precedes, and it is what is cauterying the back is olive-shaped according to its preceding shape.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter XXXII.
De cauterizacio de pes e de las coyssas.	On the cautery of feet and thighs.
Quan les pes so apostematz en ydropitz e so repletz de aygua sitrina, cove que cauterisas les pes sobre le dos del pe in nocrati aquo que es entre le auricular e le anular, e eleva la tua ma am le cauteri e no torses aquel; e aprop eleva la tua ma, e no retornes aquela de tot, quar l’aygua satrina rezuda.	When the feet are affected by hydropsy and are full of stagnant water, it is necessary to cautery the feet on the back of the foot at night, in a place that is between the auricular and the anular, and raise your hand over the cautery and do not touch it; and then raise your hand, and do not return it completely, because the stagnant water resists.
Es le cauteri segon aquesta forma: E aprop fay sobre las doas coyssas dos cauteris, e en quascuna coysa sia feyt cauteri am la extremitat del cauteri cutellar.	The cautery is according to this form: And then make on the two thighs two cauteries, and in each thigh a cautery is made at the extremity of the cautery, cuticular.
E sia le cauteri segon la longitut de la coyssa: i dejos le denolh e l’autre jos le mieg loc de la coyssa; e sobre quascuna coyssa dos cauteris.	And the cautery is according to the length of the thigh: one below the knee and another at the middle place of the thigh; and on each thigh two cauteries.
E layssa la plagua uberta ses curacio per lonc temps per so que alcuna aygua resuda de lu.	And leave the open wound for a long time, so that some stagnant water may come out of it.
E aprop cura le am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas.	And then cure them with those causes which have been said.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter XXXIII.
De cauterizacio de cos de ventre.	On the cautery of the belly and intestines.
Quan cos de ventre es per freg e per humiditat entro que debelice las vertutz, so es la vertut digestiva e retentiva, las quals so en l’estomac e en les budels, e es curat aquo am las manieyras de curacio e no confereys, e vezes le malaute suffertan cauteri de vertut exhiberant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am gran cauteri sobre le sieu stomac segon que a precedit en la cauterizacio del estomac, am le cauteri del cercle e am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic subtils, am cauteri clavilh subtil; e am cauteri sobre le alcatin sobre alozis gran, o am dos cauteris.	When the belly and intestines are cold and humid, so that they debilitate the vertebrae, it is the digestive and retentive virtue, which is in the stomach and bowels, and it is cured with those methods of treatment and do not confuse, and sometimes the suffering disease suffers from exhibiting cauteries of virtue, then cautery that with a large cautery on the navel according to what has preceded in the cautery of the stomach, with the cautery of the circle and four cauteries in the subtle circuit of the navel, with a club-shaped subtle cautery; and a cautery on the alcatin above great aloes, or two cauteries.
E si vezes las humiditatz exhuberants e le malaute aquo tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le pentenilh e sobre les budels, e fort leu ajustant dos cauteris sobre l’estomac e prop dels inguonas, quar es curacio perficent de juvament de la qual no erras.	And if sometimes the humidities exhibit and the disease is tolerating, then cautery that on the peritoneum and on the bowels, and strongly adjust two cauteries on the stomach and near the inguinal region, because it is a perfect cure of juvament from which you do not err.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter 34.
De cauterizacio de emorroydas antiquas.	On the cauterization of old hemorrhoids.
Quan so en la natura derier emorroydas antiquas o una de humors grossas fregas o de humiditatz corrompudas, e son curadas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no confereys la tieua curacio, lahoras cauterisa am tres cauteris sobre le pus dejos spondilh del dos petit e petit triangular, e am cauteri desus le ombelic cays per dos ditz.	When old hemorrhoids in the nature of the body are caused by gross humors or corrupted humidity, and are cured with what has been said in the division and do not confer the usual cure, then cauterize with three cauteries above the pus below the small triangular spine, and cauterize underneath the umbilical region for two digits.
E si doptas que l’estomac de lu sia enfregidat e la vianda de lu no sia degerida, e la cara de lu vezes apostemada, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre l’estomac am gran cauteri segon que es precedit; e am un cauteri sobre fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa de lu am cauteri clavilh, e leyssa le cauteri per alcun temps ubert, e aprop cura lu entro que sia sanat.	And if it happens that their stomach is weakened and their food is not digested, and their face is sometimes inflamed, then cauterize above the stomach with a large cautery as previously described; and make one cautery on the thigh, and another on the middle of their back with a clavicular cautery, and leave the cauteries for some time opened, and afterwards cure them from within so that they may be healthy.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De cauterizacio de atheyl aprop la abscizio de lor.	On the cauterization of athelia, appropriate for their abscesses.
Quan tu abscindes atheyl, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri que es asemblat a ray.	When you abscess athelia, then you ignite the cauteries that are assembled in a row.
Aprop entremet aquel ignit en aquel atheyl abscis, e ultima la tieua ma entro que pervengua le cauteri al orifici de la vena de la qual ve la sanc.	Then insert the ignited cautery into that abscessed athelia, and finally place your hand so that you reach the orifice of the vein from which the blood comes out.
E fay aquo una vetz o doas, quar si achieyl son trops, lahoras cauteriza quascun de lor segon que havem recontat, e aprop cura aquels am aquo que confereys a lor dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And make a vein or two, because if they achieve healing, then cauterize each of them according to what has been recounted, and afterwards cure those with what confirms their healing from within so that they may be healthy.
E si cauterizas am gran cauteri sobre alquatin, es mays derier en juvament.	And if you cauterize with a large cautery on the skin, it is more suitable for youthful treatment.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	On the cauterization of fistulas that are formed in the nature of the body in their divided parts.
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	When the nature does not obey the work that has been recommended in its place, and the patient is frightened by it, then heal with cauteries.
Donc quan ad alcun ve fistola en la natura derier, e es antiquada, corro sania de lu e humiditatz corrompudas, e donc aquo que es pus digne que cove es que proes aquela am tenta subtil, e aprop conoys la quantitat de la profunditat de lu am la devant dita tenta.	Therefore, when you have a fistula in the nature of the body, and it is old, corroding the sanity of the patient and corrupted humidity, and therefore it is more worthy that the covering is what proceeds with subtlety, and afterwards consider the quantity of the depth of the aforementioned tent.
Aprop igneys le cauteri que es semblant a ray.	Then ignite the cauteries that are assembled in a row.
E aprop met aquel cauteri ignit en aquesta fistula, e segon la quantitat en la qual intrec la tenta.	And then insert the ignited cautery into this fistula, and according to the quantity in which you introduce the tent.
E itera sobre aquela le cauteri entro que sian comburitz aquels cors corrumputz tost una veguada o dos o tres, segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And repeat above that cautery within so that they burn those corrupted bodies entirely one, two or three times, according to the quantity of your necessary need.
E guarda te de combustio de nervi e de vena; o si fistula va al cors de la vesica o al cors del budel, lahoras guarda te de totz aquels locz; e no fassas aquo sino quan la fistula es en loc carnos e cogitas que no es penetrant.	And beware of combustion of nerves and veins; or if the fistula goes to the body of the bladder or to the body of the intestine, then beware of all those places; and do not do it unless the fistula is in a fleshy place and you think that it does not penetrate.
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the place within so that it may be healthy.
E si le loc es sigillat, e so abscindidas de lu las materias, e roman ayssi per lonc temps, lahoras sapias que ja es curat entierament.	And if the place is sealed, and you have abscessed from it the matters, and remained thus for a long time, then know that it has been entirely cured.

E aprop retorna aquel am les tieus ditz e senha am tenta la ruptura sobre le os del pentenilh am senhal la extremitat del qual sia semblant a la maytat de cercle a las subiranas partidas del cors.	And then return that to the teeth and sinew, holding the rupture over the bone of the pentagonal shape at the extremity of which it is similar to the circle of the subdivisions of the body.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then ignite the cautery whose form is this:
entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	until it is very red and has many sparks.
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	And then return the intestine or hernia to its cavity, and then place your hand over the area to prevent the intestine from coming out.
E tu ja has ubert entre las coyssas del malaute e dejos lu as pausat un coyssi, et autre servent sia sus las cambas de lu, e autre sus le pietz de lu, le qual tengua las suas mas.	You have already opened the space between the patient's thighs, placed a cushion under them, another servant on their legs, and another on their chest, holding their hands.
E aprop pausa le cauteri sobre aquel senhal am la tua ma am cauteri stan dreyt, e te aquel entro que am lu consieguas le os del pentenilh entro al mieg del duiduni; e itera am aquel autra veguada si a tu aquel no has conseguit en la primieyra veguada entro al os.	And then place the cautery on that sign with your hand on the cautery straight, and you will see that it includes the bone of the pentagonal shape into the middle of the forehead; and if it does not succeed in the first attempt, try again another time until it succeeds.
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	And observe carefully the movement of the intestine during the hour of your cautery, that you do not burn the intestine so that on the patient no death or other great evil may come.
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	You should know that when you hold the cautery, do not touch the bone, and it does not interfere with your operation.
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	And it is necessary that the cautery for children be subtle, according to their age and measure of theirs.
E aprop cura le loc del cauteri per tres dias am boder entro que sia remauguda la scara del foc.	Then treat the area of the cautery for three days with a bandage, until the scar is reduced by the heat.
E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then take care of those who have other afflictions until they are healed.
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	The patient should sit on the warm seat for 40 days until the place and the wound are sealed.
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	And it is necessary to pause the nutrition of him according to the length of time of his cure, which relieves the stomach of him, and that the intestine does not come out due to the effort of healing.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And then when one wants to get up after 40 days, then administer the decent and gentle treatment, and hold that for another 40 days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And it is necessary to moderate the effort and replenishment of food and drink, and of violent vomiting, because when one uses this entire regimen of health, they will be completely healed.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And you will direct the cure of the ruptures in the other parts of the belly, and so from the beginning, and you want that they do not hurt, then cauterize the rupture with the red-hot cautery according to the quantity of it, and it is what is exhorted from the codena, thus like the third part of it; and then take care of him who has said that, and it is not adjusted.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And you will find some first rupture experts who say that the rupture should be cauterized with a triangular cautery according to this form, because it is signaled in the tents:
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	and a paused line that is for the latitude in the lattice because it surpasses the rupture, and another line below; and place your hand on a clave cautery, but the first cautery is better and more gentle.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter 46.
De cauterizacio de torcio.	On the cauterization of the thigh.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When pain is felt in some members due to a fall or percussion and it persists for a long time and does not respond to medical treatment, then it is necessary to cauterize with a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	And the cautery should be of the entire member according to its size and smallness, and its virtue and development, and location of the thigh and pain of it.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	Therefore if it is not healed by the first cautery, well; and if not, then try again on him with the cautery; because it is customary for those pains to be punctured in a member next to that one, so that it is necessary to continue with the cauteries until the patient is healed.
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.
De cauterizacio de lepra.	On the cauterization of leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Some leprous wounds are treated with a cautery for great benefit, and magnificently if the species of leprosy that is made by putrefaction of flesh and melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	And thus when you want to cauterize that, consider if the leprosy is common and as that cure which we have said in the division and not delayed, nor this, and fear about the patient whose corruption comprehends all of his body and all of its complexity, then cauterize that on the head with five cauteries: one in the middle place of the head, and one below it, and one at the end of the hair; and two above the horns; and one behind, above the nape or service.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And finally place your hand on the cautery a little while until it makes a small impression on the bone, and from it the scorched parts are dislocated, so that the exhalation of gross vapors is alleviated; and cauterize on the worse places according to what is prescribed.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	And if the leprosy has already spread over the patient and appears manifestly, then it is necessary to cauterize that with those cauteries which we have said in the head; and cauterize on the extremity of the nose, and two cauteries on each cheek, and two cauteries on each vertebrae of the neck, and six cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and one large one near the hip, and one on the hip, and two on each thigh, and one on each knee, and two on each calf, and one on each ankle, and two on each foot, and one on each toe; and cauterize that on all the joints of the said limbs and feet, and on each talon of the soles of the feet, and on the muscles, and on the tendons of the thighs; and treat them with those cauteries.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And beware of the nerves which are above the ankle that you do not touch them.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	And some wounds are treated with a cautery on the bone of the pentangle and another on the mouth of the stomach, and another on the spleen.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	And you should know that the more adjusted cauteries, the more beneficial and convenient they are; and you should know that the patient does not have pain in the cautery, thus like the wise ones, because the body of him is already stupified.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	It seems that the treatise is written in a Romance language, possibly a mix of Old Occitan and Medieval Latin.
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	"And then heal the cautery wounds with a poultice made from herbs, in a mixture of honey and another treatment within, so that it may be healthy."
Capitol .xlviii.	"Chapter 48"
De cauterizacio de stupor.	"On the Cauterization of Stupor (Fainting)"
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	"When a member is numb or asleep and is treated with medicines, oils, and emplasters, but is not healed, then you cauterize that numb member with cauterization according to the size of the member or its smallness."
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	"And let the fire of the cautery enter into the narrowness of the channel in a little while."
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	"And then heal that one with an ointment until it is healthy."
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	"And sometimes some numbness is cauterized in certain stupors which affect the hands and feet, and the vertebrae of the back, and it is said that the numbness of the nerves is what moves that member, and the stupor is relieved."
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	"There is no progress on this unless one is skilled in the anatomy of the members and the exit of the nerves throughout the entire moving body."
Capitol .xlix.	"Chapter 49"
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	"On the Cauterization of Ulcers that are Morphea (a skin disease)"
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	"When ulcers are old and do not respond to the treatments of medical ointments, then you cauterize over them with a pointed cautery for a little while according to the quantity of the specific condition of the channel until the whiteness and color of it are restored, and its color is changed."
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	"And then heal that one with a poultice made from herbs and lentils, with rose oil and leaves of agrimony, and the blood of pigeon or the blood of crane, each being a part and all are mixed together, and then place a bandage over it and leave it on for a while until it is healed."
Capitol .l.	"Chapter 50"
De cauterizacio de cranc.	"On the Cauterization of Cancer"
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	"When cancer is beginning and you want to remove it, then cauterize that one with a circular cautery in the circumference of it, just as it is turned around."
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	"And I advise the experts that it should be cauterized with the last cautery in the middle place; but I have not seen this, because I fear that it may become ulcerated, and yet I have seen some numbness."
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	"And it is better to cauterize in the circumference of it with a circle as we have said, or with many small cauteries."
Capitol .li.	"Chapter 51"
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	"On the Cauterization of Weakness (or Debility)"
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	"When some weakness is delayed in maturity, and thus it is due to the superfluity of making that, or because of the state of illness, since it is old and decrepit, with little blood, or because of time, and you want to restore it to maturity; then cauterize around its circuit with many small pointed cauteries; and afterwards let it be, for it will fasten in maturity."
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena.	"If you want to make a perforation with the cautery, then you should ignite the cautery of which this is the form; and pause it in the middle place of the weakness until it penetrates the channel."
E si le cauteri en aquel loc que es pus dejos, per so que le cors del brac sia alleujat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And if you cauterize in that place which is below, so that the body of the arm may be alleviated; and then heal that one until it is healthy."
Capitol .lii.	"Chapter 52"
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	"On the Cauterization of Corrosion (or Ulceration)"
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	"Corrosion is a corrupting disease that walks in the member, which corrodes it thus as a fire that consumes dry wood."
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	"Therefore, if you want to cauterize that corrosion in the place where it suffers from cauteries with fire, then you should ignite cauteries with many small keys, and large ones according to what is convenient in that place where the corrosion is."
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	"And then cauterize that entire part until you eradicate all the corrosion and no cause of it remains."
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	"And then let it be for three days, and pause over the cauterized places with a mixture of oil and herbs until the scars are entirely eradicated and all corruption."
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	"And then heal that one with flesh-growing ointments."
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	"If then, after three days, the flesh grows healthy in which there is no corruption, it is good; but if not, then repeat the cautery over that which remains corrupted in the corrupt places."
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	"And corrosion is treated with some old medicines with sharp medicine, because that is mixed in place of cautery."
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	"Moreover, emperor's cautery with fire is to be used for a lighter treatment."
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	"And I have said the treatment of it with sharp medicine in division, and so take that when its hours are ending."
Capitol .liii.	"Chapter 53"
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	"On the Cauterization of Fractures and other Similar Things"
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Swollen veins located at the affected parts of the foot, which are called claws, and it is a gross, inflamed cause, which hurts the foot; and it is treated with two kinds of cauteries, one with fire and another with hot water.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	Maybe the cautery with fire is that which you should ignite the cautery resembling a ball of tow, which must be made of iron according to the quantity it contains in each claw of the entire affected part, and it should have subtle margins.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	And then stop the ignited fire on the claw, and then rotate your hand with the cautery in a circular motion around the claw until the cautery penetrates to the depth of the claw.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	And leave that for three days until you start to feel better.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	And then apply a plaster made with mallows and savings thrice crushed in salt, and leave the plaster on it for a night, because it will eradicate its roots.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the place affected by generating flesh until it is healthy.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	And if it does not convert, and swollen veins accumulate on the surface of the body, especially in the hands and feet, then it is necessary that you administer those cauteries with hot water, and it is that you take a small tube of iron or fire or ball of tow, and stop it on the claw; and put a little quantity of hot water, and hold your hand, and you rotate it with compression of your entire hand, and it should be inserted into the margin of the tube in the root of the claw, and bring out the hot water through the orifice of the root of the claw; and wait for the patient to feel a little burning from the hot water for an hour, and then remove it, because the claw with its roots will be eradicated.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And thus you do to those and then proceed to the other until you overcome all the affected parts of their body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	And then heal those pus wounds because the roots of the claws are eradicated, and the flesh will be generated.

De cauterizacio de tremor.	On the Cauterization of Tremors.

E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the tremor of theirs is restored and fixed with the healthiness of the affected coldness.

De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	On the Cauterization of Accidental Wounds of the Body.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When the body is afflicted with accidental wounds, and it has pus-filled abscesses which are made of gross corrupt materials; therefore, at the beginning, it appears that it should be cauteryed over every head of the fistula with a subtle cautery of myrtle wood, the extremity of which is extended with fire; or with roots of long-lasting erestology; or with a slow-acting cautery.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.
