De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	About the cure of gouty hands and worn-out nails and incised fingers and severed sections.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Gouty hands are an abscess that grows beneath the nail of the hand or foot, and it grows in the other fingers, and as it is prolonged and its cure is less expected, or it is abscessed by a hot cautery, or it is corrupted, and it throws out a bitter humor that corrodes the root of the nail, and it corrupts all of it, and it pervades its corruption to the bone within, so that it has a foul odor, and it makes the extremity of the finger lame, and the color of it becomes dark.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And so when you have that water which we have spoken of in the division and it does not comply with your cure, then it is necessary to incise all the superfluous flesh that has grown from the nail and to cauterize the wound properly, because the cautery motion is not helpful in this case.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, and the additions of the nail are already comprehending the flesh in the divided parts, and they begin to putrefy and lead to that, then it is necessary to make a subtle incision beneath the angle of the nail that puts flesh, and to impel it upon and incise that flesh to facilitate, and pause on what remains of the flesh of the corrosive medicines that consume until it is totally removed; and properly cure that wound so that it may be healed.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	But if the corruption has already taken hold in the bone, then it is necessary to incise the bone and extract it, because no time is wasted on healing what is corrupted in the bone.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the corrosion and corruption are going into the finger, then you incise it in one of the nodes according to the premise of its removal, and properly cure it so that it may be healed.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	But if the nail has received percussion or attrition, and it is in that vehement pain, then it is necessary to begin by fleubotomizing the affected area, and properly cut the nail with a spatula-like instrument above just, and beware that the cutting does not penetrate into the flesh beneath the nail, lest you aggravate the affected painful area, and it will cause the nativity of the superfluous flesh adjusted in that place; and properly cure that place so that it ceases to give pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	But that which is adjusted, which is born in the marrow of some men, is entirely flesh, and it is entirely in the bones, or it is entirely in the nail.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of them are born in the root of the joint, or it is the nativity of them in certain nodes of the fingers.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	But that which is born in certain nodes of the finger does not become evil, and that which is born in the joints is entirely evil.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And of those that are born fleshy, the cutting is lighter, and it is necessary to incise that from its root with a broad spatula.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	But of that which is born in the root of the joint, the cure is difficult; and so beware of its abscess.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But in that which is born on the fingers from the nodes, it is necessary to incise at the beginning the flesh of it with a round incision into the bone, and properly saw with one of those convenient saws suitable for that, and properly cure it so that it may be healed.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	But consolidation occurs when it joins the fingers between their moved joints or by nativity of the man who is thus, or by consolidation of the wound or by combustion of fire, or by semblance; therefore it is necessary to cut that consolidation so that the fingers return to their natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	And properly pause between the draps of the swollen fingers in rose oil so that they are not consolidated lightly, and separate them from each other, or pause between them a thin layer of lead so that it is consolidated according to what is necessary.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And similarly if consolidation occurs in certain fingers at the palm, then you cut that consolidation according to how it is prepared and adjust it to the shape of the limb.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Of incision of veins, they are variable.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Veins are variable, and they are enveloped by gross, full superfluous melancholic humors which come from the members of the body, and the major event of them is in the legs, and mainly in the legs of travelers, laborers, and carriers.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Therefore it is necessary to administer purging of the body from black bile with certain clarified remedies for expulsion, and properly bleed the patient from the basilic vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	The treatment of iron in the blood is according to two methods: one is that it should be infused and attracted to remove black blood, and the other method is that the vein should be raised and all blood should be extracted.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The sectioning of it is according to this method: at the beginning, apply a bandage to the leg with warm water until the thick blood is resolved, which is purified by the leg, and then tightly bind the patient's thigh above the knee up to the area below the knee in one, two or three places, and then section the vein at one point, or two, or three points of wide sectioning, and then raise the black blood from the thigh above the area below the leg, and from there downwards, until the quantity of blood that you want is yielded and which has been wasted, and this tolerates the virtue of the patient.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then leave it there, and order them to abstain from eating black bitter foods that generate choleric humor.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And continue the treatment by phlebotomy when the veins are full and it is noticed to be beneficial to the patient.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	The elevation of the blood is according to this method: you who raise the patient's leg, if it has many pores, and then put them in a bath and apply a warm bandage to the leg until it becomes red and the veins are extremely full; or it should be exercised by strong exercise, if a bath is not available to you at present, until the member becomes scalded.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And then cut the skin on the right of the vein for sectioning in the loin or in the rear of the patient's back, or at the lowest part of the patient's back near the tailbone.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	And then uncover the skin with an incision and scrape the vein from every part until it appears to sensation, and it is evident that the patient's appearance is declining towards blackness.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And then when you evacuate and remove the skin, you will see that white cord which was a string.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	And then put it below the vein until it is raised and grafted onto the skin, and suspend it with a hook or iron lion.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	And then cut another section, and then cut that section for three days, and then scrape the skin from the area below the vein until it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	And then raise it and insert it into the rear section of the back near the tailbone, and then extract it and raise it until it is yielded by the second section, and then extract it from the section that is above it.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	And do it until you extract it from the section that is above or below all the sections, until everything is yielded; and then insert it.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if you are not able to extract and raise it, then introduce a strong double-edged needle and tie it and extract it, or introduce the vein below and rotate your hand to every part until it is gathered.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	And beware that it is not inserted; for if it is cut, it will be difficult for you to raise it much and it will come back over the patient through that wound.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And when all the humors are purged, then pause over the place of the open wound with a mixture of vinegar and oil, both rosated and non-rosated, and cure it until it is healed.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	And if the life is opposed and has twisted into the one that is enveloped in the parts, and it is not according to rectitude as we have said, then be careful to bind above that on every part of twisting of it and the places of envelopment of it, and then suspend it with an incision until it elevates everything.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And beware of your section that you do not insert the vein and that you do not plague it, for it will be difficult for you to raise it; and preserve your prudence in that.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	The form of the incident is what is called a sectional life:
Forma de unci orp:	Form of a hook or iron:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not to be sharpened thus with hooks or it is not of sharp extremity so that it does not plague the vein; and it is of gross flexibility, for if it were subtle, it would insert the vein by its subtlety; but it has superfluous grossness thus as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	On the extraction of the veins of the leg.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs on cold lands, just as in the land of Arabs and in the lands of India, which are hot and dry with little tenderness, and in which there are neither herbs nor trees.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And it is generated strongly in other places of the body besides the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And the gestation of it is of putrefaction that goes below the skin, just as venomous snakes and worms and scarabs and worms are generated between the skin and the flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	And the signal of the suspicion of the advent of it is from this vein that causes inflammation vehemently in the leg; and then the place becomes vesicated; and then the vein begins to yield from the place of that vesication which seems to be rooted like a plant.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	And then it appears from there the extremity, then cover that you envelop with a piece of lead weighing as much as a drachm, even to two drachms, and set that aside and let the lead hang suspended from the leg.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And as many times as the eyes of the patient indicate some cause in the affected parts beforehand, wrap that in lead and let that hang.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if the motion is prolonged, then you inject a portion of it and wrap the remaining part; and do not inject that which is too thick until it is dissolved, for if you inject that it is contradictory and enters into the flesh and causes abscesses and putridity in the area and ulceration badly.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	Because it is necessary that it be treated gently and extracted little by little, until it is freed from the back of the patient and no remainder of it remains in the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And from this vein, it is extracted in some men who are in their longitude of 5 palms and of toes, and already I have reached a point where I extract one of 20 palms.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is injected at the time of its medication, then introduce the ray into the patient's tract and perforate that long tract in the body, until everything that is in the matter is evacuated, and administer putrefying medicine to the area for several days; and afterwards cure that by curing abscesses.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And in this vein, some times the joints are stiff, and especially when they appear at the joint of the foot or in the foot, and come to the most horrific orrifics, and it is extracted from some orrific ram.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	And so cure that in this way as we have said in the division and with what has been said above.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Of the section on generated worms under the skin, and it is called cow's disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This disease is named in some land as cow's disease because many times it develops in the oxen and it is a worm that is born between the gut and the flesh, and goes throughout the whole body, weakening and deforming, and it shows the sentiment of the sick animal member by member until it disintegrates the gut and eyes.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	And its generation is due to putrefaction of certain humors, thus causing the accumulation of worms and serpents and limbrics and ascarids in the belly.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	And it is feared for its malice, because when it goes into the body and rises to the head, and reaches the liver, then it strongly corrupts the liver and destroys it, and that develops many times.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	And so when you want to cure it and extract it, then do not do so unless you have the suitable ambulation and preparation of the patient's sentiment, and then it is necessary that you strengthen what is above it and what is below it with bandages and strong constriction, and afterwards dry above it and extract it.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it is deeply rooted in the flesh and does not come out, then you pause with a cautery iron on the area until it dies, and the main cause that is feared is corruption of the flesh in which it corrupts the area as we have said.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	Perhaps sometimes it happens that it reaches the head near the liver, then strengthen above the eyebrow with a strong stricture, and afterwards dry above it, and extract it; and it is necessary that the patient use a mondification of the whole body with evacuating medicines for putrid bad humors, and beware of generating putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	Of the section on nafir disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This disease is named in our land as nafir, and it is pain that appears in certain members, and afterwards it spreads from member to member.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And now I have seen that according to what I recommend to you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	I was called to a sick woman in a village, and I discovered her swollen arm and saw a small inflammation in the vein of the arm, and after it had been numb for an hour, I saw that inflammation going up as it went towards this, but more lightly than it should be, as if it were silver, I saw when it corroded from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then I put myself in the pain of that place and fixed myself in the muscle, and afterwards I stayed there for an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And afterwards I ran to the other body until I reached the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And afterwards I recommended to myself that it revolves throughout the whole body according to what I saw; and it was too marvelous about the permutation of it and the velocity from member to member.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	And now I had seen nothing like that in my whelps according to that manner, however I have seen many of those which are born with pain being permuted from member to member.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	But I did not see that in the whelps as it was in the woman.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I did not think it was that, but rather it was because the woman was old, with dried-up body and discovered veins, and in this way it appears to the sentiment that permeated corruption.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	And it is necessary that it not appear according to this retrogression in those who are delicate and have bodies with humiliated veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	When you want to cure the patient, and they feel that pain, then it is not apparent to you in what way you should proceed, so you strengthen over that and let it be treated gently and slowly, entering that constricted area, and cauterize the affected spot.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	Perhaps you do not see the hidden ulcers, then you cure that excess in the body and that which expels bad air, and burn those foul-smelling abscesses and those serpents like similar things.
De extraccio de sagetas.	From the extraction of juices.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Juices are diversified according to species, and according to the places in the body where they flow, because their diversity is that of those with large points, and small, and concave, and rough, so they are solid; and of those with three angles, and of those with tongues; and of those with asters.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And that which is according to the members and the passages in which they flow is according to two manners: because the principal members are concave, such as the brain, heart, liver, lung, kidneys, intestines, and similar things; and then when you cut into one of these members and appear to sense death, which causes you to recompose properly, then it is necessary that you avoid extracting that juice from those in which death sits in the major dispositions, and when you do not appear with those evil senses, and the juice is not hidden in the depth of the member, then you extract it and cure the plague.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And of the senses of the brain it is when you cut into the juice, and it transgresses the bone, and it is situated on the siphac which is above the brain, because it causes vehement headaches, and scotomia, and vertigo, and rigor in the veins, and inflammation and rigor of the tongue, and spasm and permutation of understanding and vomiting of cholera, and it strongly absconds the speech and destroys the voice, and it is situated on the place of the plague with humid white blisters resembling pustules, and it seems to be affected by the similar flesh.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And then if you appear with those senses, then you abstain from the cure and extraction of the juice, unless it is not outside.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	Perhaps the senses of the juice when it cuts into the heart, so that it is near the adjacent breast, and it seems that it is fixed in a hard cause, and not a vain cause; and it strongly affects the movement of the juice, similar to the movement of the pulse, and it corrodes the black plague, and it is that coldness of the extremities, and it freezes the flesh, and syncopes; and then you know that death descends with all its might.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the senses when the juice has infected the lung, so it is beset by bloody spumous matter of the plague, and the veins that are near the colon, and it is muddied the color of the patient's skin, and it expires a great spirit, and demands attraction of cold air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	And if you cut into the juice in the veilment which is in the chest, and the pain then is near the small ribs, and it makes a great cry with vehement pain and sighing, and it does not move all the members of the muscles.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if you cut into the juice in the stomach, then it strongly affects the plague with some kind of indigestion.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	And if you cut into the juice in the abdomen, and it is fixed in it, then it is some kind of wound of the plague, or the web, or hernia which is disordered, and there is no hope in the cure by extraction of the juice.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	And if the juice cuts into the bladder, and it is situated before urine, and it processes some cause at the divided parts before, and it strongly affects pain over the patient, then you know that it is mortal.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	Perhaps the other members are like the face, the colon, and the gullet, and the splinters and the adjutors, and the spondyles of the back, and the furcula, and the coxa, and the leg and their similar members, are saved according to the major dispositions when the juice does not encounter a vein or an artery and is not a venomous juice.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And you recompose that to you which you have seen of the being of these juices, because it signifies for you about the true cure.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	Which cause is, because in one case the juice flows into the lacrimal duct of the eye from the root of the nose, and you extract it from the other part, leaving the grayish color of the aurelia, and it is healthy, and does not affect the eye with numbness.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And you extract another juice from a Jew who had it in the gray of his eye, behind the eyelid, and the juice was hidden and not obtained from that except a small extremity which adheres to the grayish fist, and it was a great juice among the sharp juices of the Turks, with iron leon in which there were no aurelias.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And the Jew is healthy, and does not affect his eye with a bad accident.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And here is the translation:
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	He extracted another arrow from a man whose belly was dislocated, and he thought that he would die from it; and therefore, since he had not moved for thirty days and no change had occurred in his condition, he examined the arrow again and began to understand its nature, and he recovered, and the bad accident did not happen to him.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	There was a man in whom an arrow was lodged in his back, and the wound had consolidated over him, and since he had been suffering for seven years, the arrow had taken root in the thigh bone.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	There was a woman in whom an arrow was lodged in her belly, and the wound had consolidated inside her, and there was no change in her condition, and the woman did not experience any discomfort in some of her natural functions.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	There was another man in whom an arrow was lodged in his face and the wound had consolidated, and they removed the arrow, not experiencing much pain, and it seemed almost miraculous.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	He extracted the arrow from the man of the king's princes which was lodged in the middle of his nose and had already declined to the right side a little, and the whole arrow was hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And he was called for the treatment of his wound, which was about to be healed within three days.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	And then he felt the wound of the arrow very slightly; and then he inquired about it with a subtle touch, and did not feel it; but he sensed it a little below the right shoulder, and then he supposed that this sensation was due to the extremity of the arrow.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	And he applied a plaster to the place where it was attracting and digestive, trusting in me that the place would be affected by what appeared to me as the place of the arrow, so that it would succeed over it.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And no significant accident occurred in that place where the arrow had reached; and he continued to apply the plaster over it for many days without any accident; and the wound consolidated meanwhile, and the pain of the extraction subsided within many days until one day I felt the arrow inside my nose and recognized it as mine.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	And then he paused on the acute corrosive medicinal wound for many days until it was opened, and with a gentle touch, he examined that, and felt the extremity of the arrow subtly, which adhered to the thigh.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	And then he adjusted the application of the wound to that acute medicine until it appeared clearly to me the extremity of the arrow, and I spent my time on that for a period of four months.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	And then since the wound was amplified, and it became possible for me to insert the forceps into it, and I mastered that, and did not obey the usual method, meanwhile I did not cease to subtly engineer and contrive about it in various ways of contraption, until one day I began to use a device with descending forceps, according to the form of those at the end of the chapter, until I extracted it; and then he restored that wound.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	And some doctors judged that the nasal cartilage was not restored, and he restored it and the wound consolidated, and the patient was completely healthy, and there remained no defect in him for any reason.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And I recommend to you the quality of extraction of certain arrows because it pauses that rule and significance about what has not been said, for the parts of this art and the definitions of it are not understood in narration nor do they comprehend them freely.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	And the artisans know how to compare little about much; and they are present about what is absent; and they find a new operation and novel instrument that descends from the external causes of the art when it happens.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And therefore I say that arrows are not forgotten in the members where they are fixed, but rather in two ways: either by attraction to the place where they enter; or by contrast with the other part.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And that which is gone by the place where it entered, or is an arrow proceeding from a carnal place, and it is attracted and forgotten.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if you do not obey the essence of the hour at which it is caught, then it happens that you will leave it for some days until the flesh that is around it becomes purulent, and its attraction and exit are alleviated.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	And similarly if it is fixed in bone and you do not obey its essence, then leave it for some days and try to attract it with motion on any day, and it will be forgotten.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if you do not obey its essence for some days, then it happens that you will perforate the circuit of the arrow in that bone of the whole part with subtle travel until the place is amplified by the arrow, and then extract it.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if the arrowhead is fixed in the bone of the head and has proceeded to one of the ventricles of the brain, and appears in the patient's symptoms those accidents which you know and say, then abstain from the extraction of the arrowhead and let it be so that it may be equalized by itself over several days; for if the arrowhead passes through the siphac, then death is not prolonged to him.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	And if the arrowhead is not fixed but only in the body of the bone and does not pass into the siphac, and the patient remains for several days, and no accidents occur to him from those causes, then you should proceed with the extraction of the arrowhead and with its removal.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	Perhaps it is not fixed and does not obey your extraction, then you should administer tarwater around the area of the arrowhead as we have recommended, and carefully cure the wound so that it may be healthy.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	Perhaps the arrowhead is embedded in the location of the body, and it is embedded in the sentiment, then you should make an attempt to probe that, and if you feel that, then you should use certain instruments which are convenient for its extraction.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	And if you cannot operate on it due to the constriction of the wound and the length of the instrument, and here there is no bone nor nerve nor vein, then you should make an incision over the wound until it is enlarged and it becomes possible to extract the arrowhead.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if you have the instruments which are necessary, then you should cut the flesh in which it is fixed from all parts to the very edge that you may be able to remove; and operate above that, if you cannot operate on the evacuation of the flesh in the fracture of the aurelhas and in twisting of those until it becomes obedient.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	And when you administer the extraction of the arrowhead in whatever location it is, then you should use a twisting motion with your hand and forceps on all parts until it becomes obedient; and subtly use a subtle subtlety so that the arrowhead is not broken and it is made difficult for you to extract it.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	And if you cannot operate on it at that time, then you should leave it for several days until the parts that are in its vicinity can be purified, and then repeat it because then it will be alleviated.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	Perhaps you have caused a contrary flow of blood, then you should administer what we have said about cure in the seventh chapter.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	And beware of your virtue of insight into veins or nerves, or cords, and administer instruments in all manner possible for the evacuation of the arrowhead; and make it facilitated and tranquil and slow and firm, just as you know and as I have recommended.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	And therefore you should make a counter-incision to remove the arrowhead so that the patient may be according to the figure according to which you have deviated from the judgment of the arrowhead in him, for it is perhaps more just.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	Perhaps if that is not possible for you, then you should administer what is possible for you according to the figures.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	Perhaps the arrowheads that are counter-set by the opposite part, or that have proceeded to some part outside, or have made the extraction of the arrowhead difficult by sentiment of the part above the codeine propounded and sometimes that is eminent; therefore you should section about that; and it should be the section according to the quantity in which they take hold with the forceps; and then you should attempt that, for it is made lighter by experience.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	Perhaps if it is retained in the bone, then you should twist the lamina according to counter-pressure until the arrowhead is embedded in the bone, and amplify its measurements, and then extract it.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	And if not, leave it for several days, and then repeat it until you find success.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	And if the thrust of the arrowhead is in that, then you should impel it with the instrument.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	Perhaps if the thrust is fallen and you want to administer impulse, then you should introduce and insert it, if it is dull, instrument concavely so that it enters the cavity of the arrowhead in the hollow of the bone and then impel it with the instrument.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	Perhaps if the arrowhead is concave, then you should impel it with a strong instrument entering into that, for the arrowhead is alleviated by that.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the arrowhead is intoxicated, then it is necessary that you concave all the flesh in which it is, if it is possible for you, and then cure it with what is convenient.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the arrowhead is caught in the foot, or in the belly, or in the bladder, or in the ribcage, and it is near so that you can touch it with your hand, and it is possible for you to section about that, then section about that and beware of insight into veins or nerves, and extract it, and then close the wound if it is indigent, and cure it until it is healthy.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	The form of forceps which are suitable for extracting arrowheads:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	They are the extensions of their ends like a bird's beak which are made with serrations when they take hold of the arrowhead so that it does not escape.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And of those are caused by excessive motions, great, few and moderate, according to the quantity of the greatness of the arrow and of the small weakness, and of the amplitude of the plague, and of the constriction of it.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	Form of impulse with the concavity of this extremity that conquers also with pain of a wing to prevent the instrument of the arrow from entering it, and an impulse of that sore:
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Form of impulse of a sore extremity:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	Also with a ray to prevent the instrument from entering it in the concave arrow, and it is propelled also at that.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	Of the bloodletting of the veins.
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so .xxx., de las quals so en le cap .xvi., so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The veins of bloodletting, which customarily run to be bloodletted thus. of those that are in the head 16. It is two pulsating veins that are near the ears, it is said in the authorities; two herbs that are in the two temples apparent; and two veins that are in the two lacrimal ducts of the two eyes that are called aspicientz; and the vein prepared in the middle place of the forehead, and the vein that is in the extremity of the nose; and two guides that are at the neck; and two veins that are under the lip; and two veins that are above the lip; and — these are the veins that are called algelic —; and it is two veins that are beneath the tongue.
