De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	About ventilation and the qualities of using those.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Ventilations are of horns, or of iron, or of glass.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And ventilation is done according to two manners: one of them is with scarification and blood extraction, and the other is ventilation without scarification.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this ventilation that is without scarification is according to two manners, because one is with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And the ventilations that are administered with scarification and blood extraction are 13 places of the body, among which one is where the nocturnal ventilations are paused, and it is the last part of the head; and the thousandth place is in two parts of the neck together; and ventilations of the chin beneath the jawbone beneath the mouth; and ventilations of two spatulas; and ventilations of alohoster, and it is on the end of the hip; and ventilations of two foci, and they are of two arms; and ventilations of two cavities; and ventilations of two thighs.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And ventilation does not extract blood except from the small sparse veins in the flesh, and therefore it does not capture the virtue through those, just as it is captured by poulticing; nor does it cover that ventilation is done with fire or without fire in any illness made for replenishment until the whole body is evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	But if it is necessary to provoke ventilation for illness or for continuity, administer it at every hour at the beginning of the month and at its end, and in the middle place of it and at some time it is.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The cause is that the humors are in those places where the blood is multiplied until it induces extraction of it through ventilation and touches the dry head, grave and solid; and from those it touches replenishment and rigor in their face and on their head, and on their neck; and from those it touches progress in their face and on their forehead, darkness and faintness in their eyes; and from those that change the place of their ventilation; and from those it is that their flow is multiplied; and from those it touches pleasure of blood in their mouth, or that the tongue is apostemed and spits out blood; and from those it is that their sleep is multiplied, and from those that see blood in their sleep, rigor and antics and plagues and other causes similar to those.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And therefore when it happens for any of those causes, and properly if it is on the third or middle of the month, then I command that ventilation should be done more than two or three hours after dawn.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And the benefit of ventilation of the nuca is that when it confers gravity on the head and adds to what is found in the eyes; but I think that it should be near evacuation of the whole body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this ventilation is at the place of poulticing of the cephalic region.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	It is not lawful to use that of him who is of complete fragility, or in which there is a flow, because it gives great harm.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And therefore it is not suitable to use those veins, and in the heads of those which are badly affected by fragile parts.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	But to him who is continuously suffering over that, it is caused by forgetfulness; and therefore it is suitable that you command the apothecary to place his hand a little above the affected parts below, fearing the generation of forgetfulness.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	The apothecary's ventilation is in the place of fleubotomia of the dark vein and of the basilica: and therefore it confers asthma, and to the constriction of the wing and to the scission of the instrument of the wing, and to all, and to repetition.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And it is suitable that the apothecary's ventilation be impelled a little, because if it is paused below, it generates debility in the body and in the stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And the apothecary's ventilation of alhagdahan confers accidental pains in the head and obtalmia, and emigration, and prefocation, and pains in the roots of the teeth; and it is in the place of fleubotomia of the basilica.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And it is suitable that you command the apothecary not to press his hand on scarification so that he does not incise the artery and accelerate fluxes of blood.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	And the apothecary's ventilation below the mouth confers to alcohol in the mouth, and to corruption of the gum, and to resemblance to those bad things that are in the mouth, and it is in the place of fleubotomia of aliheric which is in both lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	But the apothecary's ventilation that is made on both spatulas confers to captivation, which is made for repetition of heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And the apothecary's ventilation of both divided parts of the focus confers juvenation of the fleubotomia of three veins, thus it is of the basilica, dark and cephalic, because that attracts the blood from all those veins plus manifold that are in the flesh, and those manifold veins from the other gross veins until they pervade the attraction to the three veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And command the apothecary that he should not proceed too much in scarification, because the place is deprived of flesh, and below it are nerves and arteries.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And it is a ventilation with which one ventilates over the hips and confers to the hemorrhoids of the buttock and to the ulcers below.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And it is suitable that you command the apothecary to make a great ventilation, and that it be of iron, because the place induces strong dryness; and strongly they are traumatized by subtle ventilations and it should be scarified in scarification.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	But ventilations of the smaller limbs are diminished for manifest diminution, because they attract the blood from all the body, and confers to ancient pains of the kidneys and of the matrix, and of the bladder; and they provoke the menses, and confers to bothor and ademil; and it is in the place of fleubotomia of two siphons, and alahorcoben, and of two cavities.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	However, I will not belittle the entire body and cause syncopy in many places.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And from the ventilations of alahorcoben, the juvenation is propelled to the juvenation of the ventilations of both limbs.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	And the quality of the position of the ventilations is that it pauses the ventilation at the beginning of the vein and sucks for temporary suction, and does not prolong the position of the ventilations, but rather pauses those lightly, and remains with those quietly, and that the humors come to the place for adventitious ingenuity.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not cease to iterate this and continue until you see the place already enraged and inflated and that the rigor of the blood appears.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	And then you scarify and iterate the suction little by little, and properly consider in the disposition of the body.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	Because that man who is of tender flesh and rare pores, it is suitable that you scarify him once a week and no more, so that the place may not be ulcerated.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And command the apothecary to amplify the scarification and press a little, and temper the suction to facilitate.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if the blood is gross, then it is suitable to scarify twice a week, because in the first week it opens the way of subtlety to the blood and to its aquosity.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	But in the second (week) to the perscrutation acquired from the extraction of the gross blood.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is very filthy, then it is suitable to make a third scarification for that it cleans the worse.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	And gradually, when we want to extract the blood little by little or a small amount, it is enough for us to make one scarification.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we want to extract much blood, we shall make many scarifications; and if we know that the blood is gross, then it is suitable to scarify by deep scarification.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the term of scarification in which lies the depth of the ulcer so only then.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if the ulcer is large, hard, dark, and the veins are very constricted, it is because the places of the ventoses are not tender, but rather resolved; if it is in summer time, thus with oil of lavender or violet, or oil of sweet almonds, or oil of chamomile; and if it is in winter time, then with oil of narcissus, or oil of lily, or oil of camomile, or of sanic, and to those that seem alike.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if the excess is large, fresh, then the oil should be of marjoram, or of balsamic, or of lavender, or of anise, and to those that seem alike.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	Perhaps if the ventoser is of ample pores to tender flesh, then it is prohibited from oil, and it is seen that the places of ventoses are washed with lukewarm water or fresh water of solatrum, or water of chamomile, or water of bordolaguas, and similarly to those.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And that of which the wound is of much humidity, wash its ventoses with agreeable wine, or water of myrt and sumac and similarly to those.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And of that which the excesses are large, wash its ventoses with old wine, or water of sanseco, which is majorana, or of decoction of anise, or of chamomile, and to those that seem alike.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And it is seen that the ventosation should be kept at a distance from steam; having seen that it should be administered close to the steam of the bath for an hour or two, and it is seen that it sleeps close to the ventosation.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is it that should be governed so that the ventosed one is released from phlebotomy before ventosation.
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	It is seen that you consider the commencement: then if the ventoser or he who should be phlebotomized is choleric and vents about the wound with agitation and inflammation, then it is seen that it takes causes of cooling, thus with milky acetoses, and endivia in an agreeable wine, and sacanabin, and julep, and to those that seem alike.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And pause at their windows thus with poultices, and flesh of auricular spongy parts, and windows constricted with gruel, and to those that seem alike.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And of that which the complexion is fresh, it is seen that it takes in drinking essence of ivory, or essence of auricular saponaceous parts of semensas, and sumac, and there is much odorant mirth between viel and noel; and that it is commanded to use little drink and to eat, and pause at the windows of its poultices and canabir and pissers and small auricular spongy parts and columbat.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And it is seen that on the day of ventosation and phlebotomy, the drink should be more than the window.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And it is seen that it should be given in drink at certain hours to certain homes tyriaca alpharac, or medications of musk, so it is musked, or alcilite near the ventosation or near phlebotomy or nearby, so that the principal members are comforted and the wound is subtle; and it is not seen that they take that scalpel.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	Perhaps the ventoses that are scarified are ventoses that are paused on the feet, and above the ankle and gout, and above the navel, in the places of the joints, and the inflammation of the anch; because these members do not suffer from scarification over themselves.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not sought for those except attraction of wound of member, thus with paused ventosation on the mamilha in malady of flux of wound of the wounds of the nars; and use of that so that the fresh ventosity is dissolved, inviscated from the member, thus with paused on the belly and the navel; because that rarefies the member and scales it and removes the pain since resolves ventosity.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And already it is paused on the knees when they accumulate in their opacity or pus, because for virtue of strong attraction the humble opacity is fortified and eradicates the pus from its place.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And similarly it is done when it is paused on the feet and ankle, thus ventosity is enclosed in those enclosures.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	And these ventoses are administered with juice only then; and some vegetables are administered at the fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And some vegetables are administered full of water of tea in the maladies of the ankle.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And that is why the ventosation should be filled and should be more grand, thus it is hot water alone or water in which there are cooked herbs for that convenience.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of ventosation administered at the fire: it is the amplitude of the orifice of two fingers, according to how we have formed it; and the quantity of the poultice should be the size of a palm; and it is in the latz of lu, in the place that is in the circuit, the size of lu, the tube is small according to the quantity that enters into lu with a needle.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	It is necessary to make a circular motion with the hand, of large massage strokes, with the elbow, and with fingers in order to not displace the member from its position on it.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And make a gentle sweep of the hand or of iron, placing a candle flame at the focus.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And this is the great remedy that we have recommended; and the small pause of that according to the illnesses and the state of he who uses it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the cupping glasses of the old people are extended to others, that is, the cupping glasses of the young and of large bodies.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the quality of applying this cupping glass to the focus on the member is that it extends the flame decently and gently in a small candle of wax, and places it above the transverse vein at the middle place of the cupping glass, so that the fire is kindled around the partition below, lest the body of the patient be burned.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And then it is placed on the member of the patient, and the finger is on the trajectory that we have said, until when we hold the cupping glasses and do not intend to open the finger and let the vapor escape over that trajectory, then the cupping glass will be almost dissolved.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And adjust the flame according to its manner, and remove it if you sense that it is indigestible to him.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	There is a cupping glass that is administered in the case of flatulence, with water, in which there is no transverse vein or trajectory, and it is not administered unless it is filled with water, and it is placed on the member just so.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is its form: This cupping glass, the larger it is, the better, because it can receive a large quantity of water.

Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Blood-sucking cups are not administered on most members except on those in which it is not possible to place cupping glasses, due to their smallness, such as the foot and gum, and similar to them; or on a member denuded of flesh, such as the finger and nose, and similarly.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those that you have found blood-sucking cups that are on the stagnant waters of muddy places.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And then they are left in the stagnant water during the day and night until they become famished, and no cause remains in the belly of those; and then the body is evacuated through flebotomy and cupping glasses; and then the member of the patient is cleansed until it becomes red; and then they are placed above it.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are filled and fallen.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to suck out the matter from the place of the cupping glass, it is more desirable in juvament (treatment).
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And otherwise, then wash the place with vinegar and then with much water; and it should be cleansed and expressed.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the body of the wound is prolonged by the removal of blood-sucking cups, and it is that which remains, then you put a cloth of linen in cold water, and place it above until the suppuration is absorbed.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the wound is multiplying, then powder it with vitriol thrice, or gall and similar to them among the stiptic causes, until the wound is abscessed; or place on the spot the mastics of excocicated beans, and leave them until the beans adhere to the spot, and the wound is abscessed.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And be careful, if it is necessary, iteration of blood-sucking cups, when it is possible to move them.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the blood-sucking cups are prohibited from suspension, then cleanse the spot of recent wound or place a needle in the spots until the wound scabs; and then they are placed, for they sense some wound that is almost adhered.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to fall, powder over them a little of triturated aloe, or salt, or ash, and it will happen almost immediately.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the third part: of restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is very necessary in the art of medicine; and it is about the restoration of fractures and accidental dislocations in the bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh, son, know that I have thrown out of this chapter the foolish doctors and the vulgar ones who for a long time did not regard the books of the Ancients nor read a single letter from them.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason it is done that this manner of the scientists in our land is private; and I do not have it and obliated anything from it at any time; and no one has habituated to it afterwards, except through long study of the books of the Ancients and reflection on their understanding, until they extract the science from them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And then I direct my effort and study to the length of my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described in this chapter all that contains my science and about which I have passed my experience; since here I abbreviate it for you others and deliver it from occupation of elongation; and I abbreviate it at the end of abbreviation; and I show it at the end of declaration; and I form it in many forms of the instruments that are administered there, as it is done by addition of declaration, thus I have done in two previous chapters.
Capitol primier.	First chapter.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summary and collections from being broken bones, which of them a necessary prior permission is, before we start remembering the fractured members and diverse ones.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	It is fitting then that I should define the summaries of this sermon in the prohemium of this chapter; and the chapters for understanding those which from the beginning are established by the artisans and a station on the truth of those; so it is you and those who are so prompt to know or learn this noble art other than you.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And then I say that when accidents occur from a fracture or dislocation or twisting or crushing, then it is fitting that you should hasten to the beginning of phlebotomy or alleviate that, or whatever symptoms, if no cause prohibits it, thus with debilitation of virtue, or it is that which occurs often, or in decrepit state, or it is a time of vehement heat, or of vehement cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And it is fitting to be content with a diet of fresh herbs and lean meats of birds and game, and to prohibit gross meats and to fill up on diets and all diets that fill the veins of blood, until you are secure from apostema caution, and if you do not have fear of effusion of matter in the limb.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to their first regimen as it was customary for them.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And then when the broken bone begins to be restored, then it is fitting that the patient should be nourished with nutritious diets of moderate and light food in which there is viscosity, thus as if their diets were made from wheat flour, and rice, and vegetables, and fish, and cattle stomachs, and newts, and fresh fruits, and gross and similar foods to those, and at this regimen it makes a coagulation of the fracture pus more easily and milder.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And you know that the broken bones when they are in the old men who are in the first weakness and in the decrepit ones, it is not possible that they can continue and consolidate according to their nature through the desiccation of their limbs.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are consolidated and continued according to their nature all the time through the desiccation of those limbs, and they continue and consolidate those that are of theirs at the end of the lenity, thus as the bones of small children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	But nature's power adjusts and connects above the broken bone of all parties any similar cause like glue in which it is grossly stated that it adheres and strengthens until they are conglutinated and united, until they come to the end of fortification and firmness, thus as a focus at the beginning, until no cause prohibits it from their own works.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this cause it is necessary that you pause the diets of the patient, diets in which there are gravity and viscosity and grossness, thus as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Variety of fracture according to variety of the limb.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And you know that the species of fracture are diverse according to the diversity of the limbs, because a fracture of the bone of the leg is different from a fracture of the bone of the head; and a fracture of the bone of the foot is different from a fracture of the bone of the back; and similarly all the other limbs are diverse among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I have come to a remembrance of all species of fracture, explained in the following chapter, distinct from the other.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	Variety of fracture in itself is measured.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the species of fracture of the bone are diversified in their meteyssas; because there is a curved fracture other than that which occurs in the stars; and some veins are made into a fracture according to the length of the bone: and thus the fractures of the sagitta and astelhas and additio proceeding and not-proceeding, thus as it is made in the pain when it is prepared to write, and it is a fracture with plague and disruption in the head, and it is a fracture with small fissure.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And to all species is given or torment proper in restoration of it according to that which will come to remembrance of it distinctly in the following places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Sign of fracture of the bone.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And for that is recognized a fracture of the bone: it is twistedness of it, and of that eminence and appearance of it to the sentiment, and thus of it when it comprises that with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And then when it is not in the place of apparent twistedness nor is it felt by the finger touching when you touch the bone with agitation and the patient does not feel great pain, then there is no fracture here.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	It is possible that it is twistedness or small fissure, therefore you should not touch it with your hand and make compression of all; pause on it for the medicines of which you have remembrance at that moment, which convenes to the place; and then it is straight for subtle structure.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And you know that the place where it is curved and not separated into two or other than that which does not occur in the sagitta, thus as it is remembered all part of its comparison, then it is fitting to begin from your hour to rectification of it, since it has apostema caution.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if it has apostema caution, then let it be for some days until the apostema ceases; and then you should lift it according to whatever manual method you can use for lifting and generating.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	You know that restoration of it and agility of it are less than the bone in which it is accustomed to reside.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And then strengthen that second wind that will bring back the memory of it.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	Sometimes in the bone there are stagnations, then it is necessary to extend this torn member from two parts, whether it is the hand or the foot; or have your hand if the member is small; or have two cords or have a cord and the hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And it is your position in which you hold the member in its natural figure, while the extended parts of the torn member are returned, then you will perform that they return to their place and according to each manual art that you can do in their places.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And beware that you do not fall over the patient during your operation, nor cause any harm; and perform according to your gentle power that you apply one bone to another as their best companions, according to their better forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And it is convenient that at that hour you touch with your hand, and if sometimes here there is some diverse cause, rectify it and adjust it according to the quantity of your virtue.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And avoid vehement extension and compression, just as many foolish doctors who make vain gestures do, which makes them precipitate caution in their operation, or make them contradict in the member, just as we have seen through the operation of their vain gestures.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And then connect, then equate and decent operation and structure of that member, and rest and tranquility; advise the patient about it and make them avoid moving it during their vigils and sleep, and see its revolution and agitation, and deprive its ejection, and deprive all its movements with all its virtue; and beware that the position of the member is a position in which the pain is assured, which cause is because it is sent in the disposition of the position of the member or lesion; then it is convenient to permute it to another disposition in which it does not feel pain; and take care that the position of it is direct and equal, so that the member does not fall into tortuousness when it is restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the structure of the tranquil member is that which I recommend; because you know that torn members are diversified in their smallness and greatness and in the form of those.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And of those that are small such as the arm and the finger and the vein and similar to those, then it is convenient that the envelopment be with very subtle wrapping.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	Sometimes those that are large such as the hip or the leg, it is convenient that in those there be a hard and durable envelopment, because the hard bond connects the great member and strengthens it entirely in equal structure, so that in it there is no macula.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And then begin, then your evacuation of equality, pause the convenient ligament according to that, on the place of that fracture with three envelopments or four according to the member's merit; and strengthen your hand a little in the ligament.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then see that it is on the superior part above the place of the fracture, and strengthen less so that you do not force your structure on the place of the fracture.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then elongate yourself in the envelopment of the place of the fracture a little, and soften the small structure bit by bit, until you take hold of the place with a great part.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And then take another bandage and envelop that other wounded part over the torn place in envelopment, and then see that the envelopments are on the superior part below the fracture; and be your operation in the structure of the envelopment and in softening of it according to what we have said in the primary envelopment from above.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then pause between the turns of a wrapping or cloth on which the tortuousness of the fracture is equalized, if there is tortuousness in it; and otherwise, do not pause in it for any cause.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then pause on the other bandage, and then equalize over these envelopments decently made as much as possible, if in the place there is no inflammation or apostema caution, and then pause on it that settles the apostema and stops the inflammation; and lay it aside for some days; and then you strengthen over the stalks.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And these stalks are of the majesty of a reed cane, and be formed saviently; or they are of fir wood; or of palm branches; and it is the width of each stalk according to this form and figure.
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, it is convenient that the stalk which is paused over that fracture be thicker and longer a little than the other stalks, and the length of the stalk according to what is legitimated to the member in greatness and smallness; and then strengthen over the stalks with another bandage according to your primary structure; and then tie from below decently as we have said about structure, and it is that your structure be according to the place of the fracture itself, and when it is more elongated from the fracture, it mends the structure.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	It seems that the heart is making the veins larger in thickness and subtlety, and it is from the vein's own power; if the veins are too large, thus you have seen through the operation of certain foolish doctors who loosen the cords of the twisted vein, and it is a great error, when the strict structure is not equal.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	The subtle veins are not so convenient, because you do not constrict them for the strict structure that is there, and it does not seem that between this and this there is less of a digit.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is led by the extremities of the stars to the strict structure in those places, then pause and stop the flow of the lion's or lanolin-enriched ointment entering there so that it does not make a lesion.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Some bruised fractures are a plague, and they cause disruption in the code, and you will find a remembrance in that chapter according to singularity.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And you know that not all broken members are straight on the first day; the cause is that the member, when it is large, does not seem to pause over the stars for seven or eight days, according to your secure advancement of caution against aposteme.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the manner of the implanters among whom the Ancients restored, who were skilled in setting bones back in place after fracture and dislocation and twisting.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Method of implanting as a help for restoration of fracture, convenient for complex and major injuries to the veins and to the efflux, because it is about that which neither heat nor cold reaches: and it is that you take powder of millet, and it is the marrow of the flour that gives movement to the mill in the walls of the millet.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And you trust that thus it is, but that you remove the crust from the white of the egg, and pause the complexation of the non-expansive and subtle; and then use that.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another manual of implanting fractures and dislocations: recipe for assafetida, lapdanum, acacia, enula, and migrach, which is made from a thousand grains of salvaged millet, each drachm; of myrrh and aloes, one drachm; alochil, two drachms; all are ground and mixed with water or album of Huou, if the complexity of the patient's injury is scalded; and then use this implant, because it is of good composition and restores the broken bones effectively, and confers a great remedy.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another manual of implanting which confers on a fracture and dislocation: recipe migrach and metal of white alta, one drachm; of myrrh and aloes, one drachm five; of acacia, six drachms; of Armenian boil, two drachms.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	All three are ground in a mortar with a very strong contraction, and all are crushed, and all are mixed with water or egg white and it is administered.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Method of implanting for joints and separated bones in their places, and then sudden pain occurs in those and fissures and fractures: take a lane poultice and submerge it in warm oil and cook it and place it over the area.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	More in this implanting there is no virtue of restoration, of cautious aposteme and expelling pains properly.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another method of implanting that restores broken bones: take poultices of fig tree sort and poultices of salvaging poppy; mix all together and make an implanting of it.

Method of implanting abbreviated for administration gives restoration of fracture of bones and when you want resolution of the remnants of aposteme: recipe roots of altitude, of chamomile and flowers of violets, of flour of peas, of all one part. all three are ground and all are mixed with wine, if the member is not scalded.

Another method of implanting that is strong in resolution, which this first one does, when it causes aposteme hard until the restoration of the member: recipe of roots of altitude and of seeds of the iliac, and of balaustia, and mellilot, majorana, flowers of violet, of chamomile, of all one part; all three are ground and all are mixed with water of sage or water of dew or wine, all according to the quality of the member and the repose of its color.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat. Most of Galen's writings are visible because they placed emphasis on the restoration of the broken member and the causes in which it becomes dry with little warmth, thus similarly to wonder, they seem and resemble those causes that we have recounted.

Many remedies for plastering that comfort the lesion and pain: take honey, from ceses, from skins of inscized men or punishment of auzel, and of altaea, and salt, divided into equal parts; they are trissated and cribellated and they make a good plaster.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	The amount according to which one covers the lesion and then it is dislocated, is that you consider if there has been no pain nor inflammation nor the bone is broken nor moved from its place, then you do not delay for many days.

And if none of those causes affect the member that we have mentioned, then you do not delay it except for three days or four or five. and some remedies altogether are left on for twenty days according to how it appears for the dislocation of the member, thus as we have said, until the fracture adheres, and it approaches the coagulation of the flesh over that.

Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	Most of the time, if you discover the place of the fracture is dry and thin more than it should be, then you know that nourishment is prohibited from penetrating to that; and therefore embrocate it with warm water from all remedies that are applied to it; and let it be thus for three days; and loosen the structure a little, and by this operation correct the member's nourishment, and it is healthily restored.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	Most of the time, that which makes foolish restorers of a fracture of a member another way when it is not restored from the beginning, according to what is suitable, and it is restored according to twisting, it is an error according to their operation, and great fear, and if it were a director who aggravated the Antics in their free books and obtained work in that.

Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter according to: Of fracture when it affects the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The species of fractures are many, and their figures are diverse, and the causes are distinct, for some fractures are made by percussion of a space, and the percussion breaks all the bone into the ciphac, which is behind the bone, thus as it happens in the fust, and for this reason this species is named ascial; or the space incises some part of the bone, and incises the flesh of it and does not pass the incision to the back of it; and this species of fracture is named levatio absoluta.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the plague of these two fractures is great or little, and of fracture that is contraction or attrition; and its cause is percussion with poverty or falling upon stone, and it resembles them.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is penetrating that already approaches the panniculus which is behind the bone; or it is in the face of the bone, and the plague of these two fractures is great or little.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And this fracture is that which is diminished in the bone, in the subtlety of the small hair, and for this reason it is named this species of fracture capillary.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And it is a fracture that is made or by falling or by percussion of stone and it resembles them, which makes enter some lamina of the bone into the divided parts, and it is made in the concave place thus as it happens to the roles of eram when they happen to their percussion and it is divided into the entering parts.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And it is mainly made in the bodies of human bones, thus as it happens to the heads of elephants.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And so all these species of fractures are classified, so they are weighed thus as stars separated.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And you will find a remedy for all this in its place.

E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	The species of hair-like fibers is recognized by the fact that it is discovered on the bone, and it is cleansed, and anointed with liniment on their tendons, because the fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	In the cure of fractures, consider at the commencement the accidents of the patient, and then if you perceive through the accidents that signify manifest signs over fear, thus as it is vomit of cholera, and extension, and loss of understanding, and absence of votes, and syncope, and acute fever, and effacement of the veins and rigor of those, and semblance to their accidents in the major dispositions, these do not depart from sanity.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if you perceive non-concurrent accidents you hope for health, then you begin the cure of it.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The cause is that if it has come to you the plague at the beginning as it is a plague and this is in the days of winter, then it is necessary that you study the ostement of the bone within the 14th day according to total disposition.

And if it happens to you to make the detection of the bone, either blood flow or apostemic heat, then you oppose yourself to what is necessary, and it is that you fill the place of drizzling infusions in wine and oil, and make the plague repose until the apostema is sedated, and be sure of blood flow; and then begin with the circulation of the bone and its ablation.

E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And it is not so named thus except that those do not reach the term of the bone to what is near it, so that the taravel is rounded extremity or margin above that which is below the head of the agut, resembling a margin or small circle, which prohibits being submerged and passing the narrowness of the bone.

And it is convenient that you take many of these taravels in great number, which almost converge to the narrowness of each bone, until it is present to you in all tests of the brain the extremity of which is acute, the quantity in length and brevity being according to the quantity of narrowness of this test.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	And this is the form of three species of taravels: The quality of perforating in the circuit of the broken bone is that it pauses the taravel over the bone and revolves around it with the ties until you know that the bone has been penetrated; and then permits the taravel to another place, and pauses what is between all the tracts the quantity of the thickness of the radius or environs that.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	And then you cut with incisions what is between each tract of the bone, and make it more subtle that you can put on it in the end of levitation, thus as we have said, until you radiate the bone, or hold your hand, or hold some other cause for some sturments which will apparel to that, thus as you have talons and forceps subtle.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And it is necessary that you keep with total caution so that the incision does not touch any cause of the cifac.

E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	And it is a cause that has not been diminished regarding all those who have studied in that art.
