Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	On the reduction of muscle dislocation.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	You know that the muscle is not dislocated except in three ways, of which one is when it is dislocated from the top of the thigh to the bottom.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is when it is dislocated above the muscle, and that is done sharply; and it is not dislocated behind by the shoulder; and it is not dislocated below by the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	And mostly it is dislocated and therefore exits below the thighs, and mostly in those where the flesh is thin, it is easily dislocated; but in those where the flesh is thick, it is difficult to exit.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	And often accidents happen to some men through percussion or fall, and the muscle of it is inflamed with a hot aposteme, and it is bruised because it has already been dislocated.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	Then it is necessary that you sprinkle something on it until you are certain of its condition, and then proceed with the cure of it.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	And it is known that the dislocation of it is at the parts below the thigh; so that you distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the healthy one, because you find among them diverse manifest differences; and you find in the head of the concave muscle below the thigh the sign of the head of the muscle as if it were a vacuum, and the patient cannot reduce his hand to its proper position, nor can he do it with all movements.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is dislocated from the feet or above, then you will find a manifest sign, and it is not hidden.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And from this dislocation, an easy reduction is made when it is fresh and the patient is young.
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	And the reduction of it is that the minister raises his hand to the parts above; and then pauses with the fingers placed below the thigh, and strengthens the joint in its proper place, and the minister raises his hand, and extends it thus; and then pauses it below so that it returns easily.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	But if it does not return for what we have said, and so from the beginning that the dislocation occurs, many days, then it is necessary that the patient be bathed in hot water and be given an embrocation that softens and loosens as if it were a poultice of fenugrec, and melillot in water, and be administered.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	And then the patient should be placed on his back and paused below the thigh, waiting for a day that it is restored between levitation and stricture, and then the doctor pauses the whole talo over the spine, and raises the head of the muscle in a circle, and holds the hand of the patient so that it is not hidden at the parts below, and another minister holds the head of the patient, so that it is not hidden at the parts below, because it returns thus to its proper place.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	And if you wish, reduce it in this manner: and it is that you make yourself present as a man who has been placed longer than the patient, and stands on one side of the bed, and inserts his hand below the thigh of the patient and raises the thigh above to the parts so that the patient is suspended in air, and another minister pulls the hand of the patient from the parts below the belly.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	But if the patient is light, then it is necessary that another cause be suspended, so that it weighs on that, because the dislocation returns quickly.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And it is reduced in this way: and it is that a long stick is fixed on the ground with a rounded head of figure, like a pile of mortar, not too big or subtle, and then paused below the patient; because being placed over the head of the stick, the patient stands according to the length of the stick, and then extended his hand to the parts below the other part; and the body is strengthened from the other part in fortitude, because the joint returns to its proper place with velocity.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	And if it is difficult to reduce it for all the causes that we have said, then use this cure: and it is that you take a stick of the quantity which is in length of two arms, and its width is of four fingers, and its thickness is adjusted on the surface of the thigh according to this form.
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	And place above the reddened skin a cloth soaked in warm lion's milk, so that it does not harm the patient.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	And place the patient's small intestine in its proper position, and stretch out your hand or arm over the joint towards the divisions above, and place the joint over the adjuster and the arm and the extremity of the hand.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	And place the arm on a scale of steps according to the latitude, and the hand is stretched out towards the divisions above, and the other thing is suspended from the other part, so that the inner joint is straightened as much as possible.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	And when the instrument is complete according to whatever method you can, and then cover it so that you pause below the small intestine with a quantity of wool equal in weight; and place a plaster prepared with powder of moly and album of wolf on all the muscles, thus that it is revolved from above, and place strength below the small intestine with decent structure; and the ligament is revolved over the plaster, and the hand of it is annexed to the neck of it, and let it be, and do not move the hand of it for seven days.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And cover that the food of the patient is paused for a little while, until the member is comforted, because it is easier to bring health to him.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	And then the food is given more abundantly after seven or eight days, and an exercise of movement is done; and thus if it is strengthened and not softened, then it is already healed.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	But if the joint is dislocated often due to humidity that affects it or for another cause, then cover that in that case there should be administered a cautery with three tractions, according to what has been said in the chapter on cauteries.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	And if all this is done and seven days are elapsed, the ligament and joint are not strengthened, and the plaster and structure are reduced over certain affected areas, and it is not strengthened and can't be elevated to the parts above, then know that the nerves of it, which are at the head of the muscle, are already injured or extended or softened, and know that the joint will never be fixed in its proper place.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	From the dislocation of that which is done from the feet and knees or the back parts, the reduction is done with impulse and extension in the hands, until it returns to its place.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And another structure should be administered there, and care for it until it is healed.
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	And if it affects the healing gravitating in the member and slowness in its movement, then the patient uses many affected areas until that gravity is alleviated and returns to its original nature.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	On the cure of dislocation of the hip.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	You know that the joint of the hip is dislocated with difficulty and similarly returns with difficulty; and it is dislocated in all parts, and especially from the front to the back, and the dislocation of it is not hidden from you because it falls below the vein or below the touch according to whatever figure is dislocated, and when you adjust the dislocated hip to its place, that is manifestly declared to you, because the joint is concave and cannot bend the arm, nor touch the underlying muscle.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And you know that the hips, and reduce the dislocation as much as possible from the front before it comes to the apostema of the hip, because if it comes to the apostema of the hip, difficult is the reduction of it, and often it is not healed at all; and especially when it is in the back parts, because worse is all the other species of dislocation, and of major pain, and many affected areas are dying from that.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	And the restoration of it, when it is possible to reduce, is that the hand of it should be extended with two fingers, and its arm should be expanded, and the fingers of the metacarpus are placed above the hip and below it, and the joints are fixed in the hollows of their own fingers, or at the root of its palm until it returns to its place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	But if the dislocation is in the front parts, then it returns also so that it bends the hand with its own hand, until it strikes the hip at the root of its palm.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not obey the reduction, then administer vigorous extension and very strong force.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And it is that two ministers extend the arm, and hold that same thing with two ministers so that it is not removed from the extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	And then the arm is revolved from all parts, because it is enveloped in a doubled cloth over its hand, or ligament.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the metacarpus touches the joint with its hand, until then some oil is poured for so that it helps in lubricating the joint and facilitating; and then fix the joint with a strong push until it returns.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	And then the reduction of it is covered by placing it on a plaster in which it is stipulated and excised with album of wolf, and it is strengthened in a decent structure, and the arm is suspended from the neck, and let it be for some days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	And then it is released; and so if the joint is formed in the same place, then you release the bandage of it and let it be like that.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	And if you see the joint is not strengthening, then you iterate the plaster and bandage, and let it be like that for several days until it is externalized; and then release it.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	Maybe it happens to him by gravity towards the reduction of the joint, and its disposition is in movement, then administer humid heat in bath and subtle friction, and compress, until it is alleviated; or place a cushion on the alleviated joint, so it is not bothered by excessive motion; and then it is tied, and let it be like that over the bone day and night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And then remove that, and put it in bath; and when it sweats, then you warm the joint with tempered friction, and then place it over the alleviated one, so it is rounded by motion, one time, and the second, and the third.
am intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	in a wrapping of bath, until it is relaxed.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you want, place on that wound of humid and scaled skin with a bandage and strengthen over it; and do that several times, because that is humid and reduces to its disposition.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	About the treatment of dislocation of the shoulder, which is of the joint that is between the arm and the hand.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	A shoulder that has some veins is dislocated, and the reduction of its dislocation is easier, and the opposite is for other joints, but mainly because it needs velocity in the reduction of it at the hour when it is dislocated, so long as the place is apostematized or it doesn't happen to it an apostemic affection.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the reduction of its dislocation is that you place the joint of the patient's arm on a table and the doctor extends his arm, and he places his hand or his palm over the prominence of the joint, and presses it until it returns to its own place.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	Maybe it is necessary to consider if the palm has been stayed against the belly of the arm, then the patient places his back on a table for extension and reduction; and if the dislocation is preceding over the back of the arm, then the position of the doctor's hand is intrinsically above the table, so that the doctor's hand fits over that prominence of the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And then if it returns soon, good is; and if not, then strengthen that with an emplaster at once the apostema and let it be like that; and do not iterate that, because if not, you will not suffer nor be able to put on the reduction of it, since it passes into its days.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	Maybe the joint is Roman according to its tortuosity; and do not notice to the patient any cause, but that the hand is mollified and cannot strengthen any cause; then you know that the nerves are cut or torn, and then it is not engendered in it unless it is strengthened with a pointed cautery for the sake of its treatment and fortifying its confidence in some cause.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Then when the shoulder is returned, then place on it the emplaster which we have recommended, and let it be like that and strengthened for five days; and then release it and let it be like that and the hand of it should be exercised.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	Maybe if the movement of it is stayed and happens to it some gravity, then you warm that with hot water and friction several times, until it is alleviated.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	About the treatment of dislocation of the toes.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Several times it happens that the toes are dislocated completely.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when some of those toes are dislocated to the back of the palm or to the belly of it, then hold the toe and press the dislocation of it with the tied fingers, until it returns.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And then sustain the head of the toe, and suspend it from the part where it is dislocated, and let it be like that for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And then suspend it and extend it until it is straightened in its own day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when it is night, bind it according to that narration, and do not cease to release it during the day and exercise its movement, and bind it at night; and do that for several days until it is strengthened.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And do similarly to that, if it is dislocated at the belly of the hand, and bind it to that part and do that first operation on the injured toe, until it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And similarly do that when it is dislocated at other parts.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	About the treatment of dislocation of the vertebrae of the back.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When it happens to some of the vertebrae of the back or neck a complete dislocation, and so many vertebrae are removed from their places, then in that case there is no cure, because death approaches the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And it is said that the evacuation of the patient is out of their will, and they cannot retain it; and many times some members of it are mollified or two heads of it or two arms of it, or one of those; or a vertebra is removed from its place, because many times it is removed and many times it is done the removal of it in four parts.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Therefore, it has been decided that the affected parts behind are numbness and are called geltosity.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	The treatment of it is that sometimes you should consider whether the geltosity comes from poverty, because sometimes there is no cure for it nor any healing of all.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	Maybe in this case you see by chance or by percussion or by similarity to those, the Ancients had manners of treatment in sermons very prolix, from which the most returns to profit; maybe you have already heard about that one from whom little is known of his tropism, due to his proximity to my intention, in which he has expounded and formed diverse instruments of that, with which I will show and expound it.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And I say that in geltosity that comes from the front of the foot, there is neither engendering nor healing of it; and similarly in this case that it is done to two sides.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And of those, none are cured except the one that comes from the back properly, just as I recommended.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And it is that the patient should be extended on their face over a soft pillow near the wall, and should be extended with his extremities mollified so that the foot of the patient is not lifted.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And then a straight stick should be placed, fixed in the ground at the extremity of the bed near the patient's head, and another stick in the air above their feet on the other side of the bed.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And one minister holds the stick, and it should not be fixed in a trench; and another minister holds the other according to that form.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then envelop over the patient's head and below tighten the little linen band firmly; and extend the extremity of the linen to the stick which is above their head, and tie it on them; and then strengthen the other band around their hips, and above their legs; and then adjust all the bands and tie them on the other stick which is above their feet.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And then the minister should carefully extend the band to the part of the stick, and they should not be numbness in the two sticks and the bands from their own places where they are fixed, maybe however they will not be firm as we have said.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	And the doctor puts his palms on the spine with strong pressure until it returns, or puts on that one table, and then adjusts on the table their own feet until it returns.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	Maybe if it does not return by this method, then take a table of which the width or length is in the air of three arms, and dig into the wall where we have said that it is near the patient, a place where the extremity of the table enters.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And then place the flat surface of the table on the spine, and the doctor puts his feet on the other extremity, and stretches well until the spine is constricted and returns to its own place.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you want, remove what is revolving in the hand; and it is that you fix on the ground above the patient's head at the back of the bed two sticks, the length of which is one arm, and above their head at the back of the bed also two sticks; and let the length be between each stick a palm, and already it is done in each stick through which the course is turned, and each should be firmly fixed on the ground so that it does not move.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And let there be a round stick in which the course is turned, and let it be revolving in the two tracks of the two sticks.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at the extremity of it there is a track in which the stick is formed, the length of which is one palm where it is revolving; and in the two other sticks it is similar to that.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then strengthen the bands that have been stretched on the feet of the patient in the track which is above their head, and the bands that have been stretched on their thighs in the course which is above their feet.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And then there will be each course and there will be a minister who turns the course with their hand, and the doctor will straighten the spine according to what we have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is the form of the course:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And then because the spine has returned, and the place is straightened, then it is necessary that you put a plaster exciccatiu on the album of Huou, and then stop; and then put on the plaster like a table of which the width is three fingers or around them, and its length is as much as the place of the geltosity, and above the part of the spine.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And then it should be tied with the band that we have said, and use the patient's subtle nourishment until they are healthy.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if there remains some impediment in the place at the end of the healing, then it is necessary that medicines which mollify and liniscan are administered with administration of the table for a long time, which we have recommended; and already it has been administered in that place a lamina of lead.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And some evacuated humors accumulate in the back of the two spines, and it is gathered for that dislocation; and it is that bone which already has been minimized so that it does not converge to make a prosompcio with this medicine, because it will strongly contradict you to come to that mort.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	About the treatment of a dislocated ankle.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	You know that the joint of the ankle and the joint of the muscle do not simply dislocate, but rather it is because of something that happens to those joints with small movements and cavities.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the ankle joint is dislocated in four ways, either it is dislocated inward, or outward, or forward, or backward.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And mostly it is dislocated inward, and rarely outward or forward or backward.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And the sign of dislocation inward is this: when you adjust the leg of the healthy side to match the sick one, it is then longer and more prominent than the healthy one, and the sick leg cannot bend its knee towards the shin, and it is in that place where the shin bone is displaced from its proper position, so that the head of the thigh bone has deviated here.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	And the sign of that one which is subject to outward dislocation is that the accidents of it are contrary to this accident.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	And the sign of that one which is subject to forward dislocation is that it expands the leg according to its natural tendency, but it cannot bend because of the pain in the shin, and if you try to walk and cannot put weight on it forward; and its urine is retained and its knee is displaced, and its walking is impaired on the ankle.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	And the sign of that one which is subject to backward dislocation is that it does not expand the shin, nor can it bend forward because the knee cannot bend, and its leg is shorter than the other, and the knee is weakened, and the head of the thigh bone is out of place.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	The main reduction of the species of this dislocation is that you consider, then, if the dislocation is old and chronic, that it has already become accustomed to having it, you will administer reduction of it according to its disposition, then it is not in total cure; and therefore it does not seem that there can be perfect recovery.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	But in that one where the dislocation is recent, and it is one of the four species of dislocation, then you will find what you need to return the joint and extend it inward and outward, and move it to the right and left, so that it returns strongly and does not require another cure.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	But if it does not return in this way, then you need to prepare a strong minister and extend the leg from the part that is below, or with its own muscles, or with the ligament that is tied above the shin; and another minister extends the hand of that one downwards so that it reaches the muscles below the thighs; and you strengthen the ligament on the joint of the thigh bone, and hold another minister to straighten the extremity of the ligament.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And its extension is from the ankle to the knee, or from the inward part to the outward part, or from the backward part to the forward part.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And its extension is all of these in one way so that the sick leg is elevated above the level of the ground and remains suspended.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this species of extension is common to all four.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And therefore if the dislocation returns to what we have said, it will be good; and if not, then it is necessary for all species that we spoke of in the proper cure.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the reduction of its own, when it is dislocated, and the dislocation is inward, you need to resupinate the sick leg above the healthy one; and then pause the ligaments on the joint of the thigh bone in that place where the head of the thigh bone is between the shin and the knee; and then extend the ligament from the part of the knee to the outward part of the furcula.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And then another strong minister takes the arms of it, and firmly grasps the large joint of the sick thigh and extends outward with vigorous extension, so that it returns to its proper place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this species is of the most gentle cure in which this member is reduced, unlike the other species.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	But if it is exhausted above you and does not obey the entrance to this species of cure at all, then you need to tie the two feet of the sick leg together with a strong ligament, gently, above both ankles and both shins.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And its length is of each one according to the quantity of four fingers, and the sick leg is extended more than the other by a quantity of two fingers.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And then the sick leg is suspended above the head of the beam, and it is in the pulley; and its length from the ground is a quantity of two arms.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And then command a strong youth to move the head of the thigh bone, and it is suspended with the sick leg another youth, and the other youth moves the thigh bone in strong empowerment, so that the joint returns to its proper place with velocity.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	Most in the reduction proper, when it is dislocation at the fore part, it happens that the patient leans over a support according to what we have recommended in having gelatinized; and strengthen the ligament over the affected leg properly and over their chest.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And place two pads, one on their feet, and the other on their head; and place two adjusted pads on the middle of the affected joint, over which the humors are enveloped, so that the patient is not damaged by the pad being between their thighs, so that the extension to the lower parts does not become twisted.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And each minister extends to their own part, and the doctor has their hand engaged in the reduction according to the art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Then, if you obey the reversal, it will be great; and if not, pause over that diligently and thus as we have said in gelatinizing for that engagement.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	Most of the patient leans on their sides, which is the quietest position.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is in the lower parts, then it happens that the leg is extended lightly, and it is according to this narrative method on the joint; and the doctor places the palm of their right hand on the affected side, and then cuts off that hand with the other hand, and in that cutting off, they pause the extension to the lower parts at the part of the ankle.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is in the upper parts, then it does not happen that the patient is extended to the lower parts, and it is elevated above the ground; however, it happens that they are placed on a hard surface, thus as it happens with the examination if their ankle is dislocated at the fore part, according to what we have said about the setting of them on two ankles; and it is on their face and the ligaments are extended, according to what we have said, there is no harm.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And it happens that an administered compression is applied to the table on the area where the joint is located.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	Then, since the reduction is completed as it happens — and the sign of the reduction of them is not hidden from you, and it is that you extend both legs of the patient, and when you see those joints and the patient stretches out their leg and expands those excuses, then you know that the member has returned to its place — and then you adjust both thighs and place a bandage and stretch on a splint so that the ankle does not become dislocated in any of the parts; and adhere the patient to rest for three days or four.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And then release the ligament and the bandage, and compare one leg with the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	Then, if you see those joints in their proper place, then you know that the dislocation is already fixed, and therefore the patient can walk again.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any cause of softening, then you return and apply that, and stretch it according to your primary structure, and leave it for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	And then release it, and make it wait in ambulation over some crutches for some days, until it is comforted.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	On the Cure of Dislocation of the Ankle.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The ankle is dislocated in three ways, because it is dislocated at the fore parts, and at the hind parts, and sometimes at the lower parts more than at the upper parts; and at the lower parts it is not dislocated.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of dislocation of it is that you order the patient to apply their leg to the thigh; then you know that the ankle is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all its ways is that you make the patient straight, thus they extend their leg, if possible; tie the two to the face of it, and place their foot between the two feet; and then make them hold the ankle with both palms, and retain those between the two fingers on the ankle with strength, and another minister extends the affected foot until the ankle returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the sign of reduction of it is that their leg adheres to the thigh without labor or effort.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And then apply that and make the leg adhere to the thigh, and then tie those together with a bandage for three days or four, and then release them.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And do not allow the patient to walk about for some days, until they are healthy and comforted.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	Most of the reduction of it is excused, then you must strongly extend the ligaments in the cure of the preceding narrative on the treatment of the hand.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	On the Cure of Dislocation of the Ankle.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The ankle sometimes is removed by small movement, and sometimes it is dislocated according to completeness, and the dislocation of it is made either at the hind parts or at the fore parts.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of dislocation of it is that you see the ankle inflated proceeding to the part where it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	The cure of the patient's movement is to reduce fatigue, and it is necessary that it be extended with facilitated movements and enclosed within so that it returns.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	In the cure of one who is dislocated according to complement, it behooves that you straighten the patient's right side, and hold that strong and valiant minister behind the back of that one in the middle place of theirs.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And then you put your right hand on the upper part of the foot above the ankle, and your left hand below the foot at the place of the calf.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And then you pull the foot with your right hand, and place your left hand for two fingers' width, and stretch out your left hand; and you bend the foot's toes towards the leg's knee.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And make two finger-widths according to what we have measured.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	And then you bend the foot's toes towards the third finger-width, and you are at the calf.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	So if it returns to one finger-width or two according to this method, and if you find the foot enclosed, it is good; and if not, then repeat the operation, because that returns.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	But if you are prohibited from reducing it with what we have recommended, then place the patient on their back on the ground, and stretch out a blanket firmly fixed to the earth, and enclose it between the patient's thighs, and you have already enveloped it with a cloth so that the patient does not escape.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And the minister of theirs holds their thighs, and another minister stretches out the foot with their hands or on the collar of the foot; and then stretch out that certain minister against extension of the back part, and the blanket is stretched out between the patient's thighs, retaining it, so that the body of theirs is not attracted to the lower parts from their extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And the doctor encloses the dislocation with their hands, and another minister holds the healthy thigh at the lower parts, so that the dislocation returns to its proper place with ease.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And thus when the dislocation returns and it is declared to you the health of the reduction of theirs, then pause the plaster and stretch out that strongly with the bandage, and tie the foot to the leg.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And it behooves that you fear or guard against the nerves which are behind the heel, so that the bandage on that is not violent and holds that strongly.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And then leave it like that for two days or three; and if the bandage is softened, stretch it out.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And then remove it on the third day or fourth, and prohibit the patient from moving for forty days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	But if it is forced to go before that space, it is not done securely so that the dislocation does not dissolve and corrupt on them, and then that which does not receive cure.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if you happen to find a postrema wound, then it behooves that you administer in the cadence of theirs what precedes our narration, in another place of cure and of embrocation, until it is remedied.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter 34.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	Of the cure of dislocation of the toes of the feet.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	It behooves that what is dislocated be enclosed with little extension of its knees; and that which is not difficult, it is easier.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	But if the dislocation is in some joints of the foot, then it behooves that you straighten the patient's foot on the ground or on a table, and it should be standing thus as if it were walking.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And then you stand on your feet, and pause the foot on what is imagined of the joints, and then calcify that with your foot in a upright position until it returns, and see that it is already enclosed and does not appear in the prominent place.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And then pause below the belly of their foot on a table that takes the whole foot, which has two cups, and then stretch it with decent structure and firmness for three days; and then remove it and make them rest from walking for many days, until it is strengthened and its reduction is assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Of the species of dislocation that are made with plague or fracture or some other evil signs.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When you happen upon any of those causes, and you fail in the cure of that and in the restoration of theirs, many finger-widths succeed in bringing about death.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And for that it does not behoove to presume about the cure of theirs, except he who is wise in the art, with long experience, merciful and pitiful, tardy, not hasty nor presumptuous; and who uses at the beginning of medicines that heal apostemas so well, and leaves the patient to divine judgment, but to him from whom you hope for salvation, from alleviation of evil, and in which appears some hope.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And then it is necessary to hasten so much to reduce it at the beginning of the cause, lest an apostema wound occurs.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And then if the limb returns to its desired position, then administer careful regulation, which will cure the wound and heal the plague that is convenient for him from the swelling of the affected parts.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if the dislocation is a fracture and it happens in the separated bones of the sacrum, then you perforate their statement, and make it so that we have said in the simple cases of this type that it is preceded in those places.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And beware and flee according to your virtue from the instrument of fear through the ways which are shown to you as it was preceded by my prediction; for it is better for you to give thanks to your Creator, and may it be more permanent in your glory, and may there be more salutations to your body verily in that time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus you will finish the prayers of Albucasim, perfectly fulfilling those which God may bless.
Amen.	Amen.
